byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Baghdad; Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations. Omar Al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD, ANNE BARNARD and SOMINI SENGUPTA

abstract: Rising hostilities between Iran and Saudi Arabia over Saudi Arabia's execution of Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr threaten Iraq's ability to unite Sunni and Shiite factions against Islamic State; execution puts Iraq in difficult position as it seeks to maintain alliances with United States and Iran.
lead_paragraph: As Iraq faces the challenge of routing ISIS, it is confronted with a conflict between Iran and Saudi Arabia that threatens to inflame sectarian tensions.

headline.main: Saudi-Iran Feud Poses Threat to Iraq’s Effort to Combat ISIS
headline.print_headline: Saudi-Iran Feud Poses Threat to Iraq’s Effort to Combat ISIS

snippet: As Iraq faces the challenge of routing ISIS, it is confronted with a conflict between Iran and Saudi Arabia that threatens to inflame sectarian tensions.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
